meanings.definition: Repeating or continuing a behavior, thought, or activity excessively or for an extended period of time.
meanings.sent1: The perseverative child kept asking 'Are we there yet?' throughout the entire car ride.
meanings.sent2: Her perseverative nature made her a dedicated student who never gave up on her studies.
meanings.sent3: The perseverative squirrel kept burying the same acorn over and over again, thinking it was a new one.
meanings.sent4: His perseverative focus on the project was like a laser beam, never wavering from the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The image of the perseverative ant tirelessly carrying a leaf many times its size stayed with me.

meanings.definition: Tending to persist in a particular pattern of behavior or thought.
meanings.sent1: The perseverative student always sat in the same seat in the classroom every day.
meanings.sent2: His perseverative mindset led him to approach every problem with the same method.
meanings.sent3: The perseverative cat insisted on sleeping in the exact same spot on the couch every afternoon.
meanings.sent4: Her perseverative attitude towards exercise was like a well-oiled machine, never deviating from her routine.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the perseverative clock ticking away the seconds without pause stuck in my mind.
